Hey boys and girls, what's up? I'm Ethan, your 
RealLife English Fluency coach. And as you

might guess from the name of this channel, we love 
TV Series! All the time learners ask Andrea and I

what new TV Series we recommend that they learn 
english with ! So, we decided to make a video sharing

10 of our favorite series that we've watched 
so far this year! We've chosen from a variety of

genres so anyone will be able to find a new series 
they will love from this list! And if you want to

easily comprehend some of your favorite series, 
well, every week we make lessons with TV Shows

and help you to understand them without getting 
lost, without missing the jokes and even without

subtitles Like Anouar who now feels more confident 
speaking to and understanding foreigners in their

job thanks to our lessons! Now, let's jump into our 
list of the top 10 Series to learn english in 2021!

This drama series stars Jason Bateman 
as Marty Byrde, a financial planner who relocates

his family from the big city of Chicago to a

The reason they relocate is because a money

lord in order to keep his family safe. This

once ordinary family living ordinary lives must 
now adapt to their new life in order to survive.

Alright, so this one is much more 
lighthearted. Upload is a bit like black mirror, but

it's a comedy taking place in the near future with 
electric hover cars, virtual reality and a digital

afterlife. So, the series starts out with Nathan 
being in a near fatal car crash, and his girlfriend

uploading him to a luxurious digital afterlife 
called Lakeview. He's able to live forever here

and even meet with his loved ones. However, the 
catch is that it's a bit like a social network

with in-app purchases, meaning not everything is 
included. This is a great series if you love sci-fi

and technology, and it's fantastic for learning 
vocabulary related to tech. It will make you laugh

but it also includes aspects of romance and even 
intrigue. It certainly got me thinking about what

the near future could be like as not everything 
in the series is so far fetched.

This is an American comedy that 
depicts the misadventures of a close-knit group

of Harvard alumni in their 40s as they navigate

each other in New York City. The series explores 
old friendships former romantic entanglements

I love fantasy series like Game 
of Thrones, so this one from Netflix was right up

my alley. It follows Alina Starkov, an orphan who

Now, in this world Grisha, which are like witches,
